summary:
I am the founder, since 2012, of WATERWYS, where I continue my profession in the water sector. I am a firm believer of integrated water resources management as a framework for regional planning and its enabling role in the environmental and economic development sectors of society. My interests have an international focus, recognising the importance of institution and capacity building to maximise sustainability in our interventions for development with focus on the challenges presented by the international water, food and energy nexus.

I have a professional career of 52 years as a civil engineer in hydrology, geo-hydrology and water management. I have 20 years of resident overseas experience in America, Africa and Asia, and 27 years of resident experience in The Netherlands, working for international organisations and for leading Dutch research organisations TNO and Deltares. My work has included both content and line management including project management and supervision, institution building, knowledge transfer and capacity building. More recently my work has focused on the technical assistance preceding, during and in the aftermath of water-related disasters. I am one of a pool of team leaders of the  DRR (Dutch Risk Reduction) team, an initiative of the Netherlands Government to assist countries facing disasters. My experience allows me to offer strategic technical, institutional and organisational advice to strengthen water resources management and development capacities in organisations and countries.

organizations.name: KIVI - Royal Institute of Engineers, The Netherlands

profile_positions.title: Team Leader DRR mission on water governance

profile_positions.description:
Continuation of contribution to the project Strategic technical Assistance to the National Water Directorate in Mozambique in several missions. Accompanying the Minister of Public works of Mozambique on his visit to The Netherlands. Organising and participating in a workshop in Maputo on Flood & Drought Control in preparation of the establishment of a Flood & Drought Control unit in the Directorate. 
Two missions to UN-ESCWA in Beirut to participate, as member of the Water Group, in the completion of Phase I of the National Agenda for the Future of Syria (NAFS) and in the start of Phase II.
Developing two Strategic Plans 2017-2021 for the National Directorate of Water Resources Management and for the National Directorate of Water Supply and Sanitation.
Project Leader of the Feasibility Study for the Beira Port Access Road of a consortium of ANTEA Group, COnsultec, Movemobility and IP3eu, one of the priority projects of the Beira Master plan. Feasibility study on the different road alignment  alternatives for access to Beira Port, including a Social and Environmental Impact Assessment.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor at Waterwys

profile_positions.location: The Hague Area, Netherlands and Mozambique
profile_positions.description:
Commissioned to accompany the Minister of Public Works, Housing and Water Resources Management of Mozambique on his visit to The Netherlands, his participation in the Amsterdam International Water Week and the celebration of the 40 years of water cooperation between the two countries.
Contract from the National Directorate for Water, Mozambique, subcontracted by HKV as Manager of the Dutch Team of the project “Strategic Technical Assistance to the National Directorate of Water”, Mozambique. This project is two years . A first mission was carried out in June 2015.
Continuing participating in the Working Group Water in support of a National Agenda for the Future of Syria (NAFS) initiative of the UN-ESCWA, Beirut.
Team Leader and Rapporteur of a Disaster Risk Reduction Mission to Mozambique, to advise the Government on IWRM and Flood Control of the Licungo Basin.
Team Leader and Rapporteur of a Disaster Risk Reduction Mission to Pakistan, to advise the federal Government and the Government of the Punjab on IWRM and Flood Control in the Indus River Basin.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Selected as team leader in the Dutch Risk Reduction Facility.
Support to UN-ESCWA, Beirut, developing a long term water vision for the National Agenda for the Future of Syria. Missions to support Dutch Government in support to Syria.
National Directorate of Water, assist in developing the strategic plan for the (new) National Water Directorate of Mozambique.
Co-author, with Clingendael, of a report analysing the possibilities and constraints for Dutch support to the water sector of Syria in the context of its broader, future, economic recovery effort.
Teamleader, rapporteur of a scoping mission on flood recovery through IWRM and physical planning in the lower Zambezi Valley.
Team member, rapporteur of a flood recovery mission defining assistance programme for increasing flood resilience and mitigating the effects of floods in the Limpopo valley in Mozambique. Supporting the Dutch Government role as Lead Country Water in the Friends of Syria Platform on Economic Recovery.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor 2013/14 at WATERWYS

profile_positions.description:
2012
Set up WATERWYS. Author of report on the possible ways of providing Dutch water management expertise during international water-related disasters. This report saw the start of the DRR (Dutch Risk Reduction Initiative).
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor 2012 at WATERWYS
Senior Advisor/Director International Cooperation and Manager Business Development
Senior Manager Business Development

profile_positions.description:
Netherlands Representative to CCOP, the Coordinating Committee for Geoscience Programmes in East and Southeast Asia, an intergovernmental organization to facilitate and coordinate the implementation of applied geoscience programmes in East and Southeast Asia in order to contribute to economic development and the improvement of the quality of life in the region. Deputy Chairman of the Advisory Group, consisting of the representatives of the cooperating countries Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Japan, The Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Russian Federation, Sweden, United Kingdom and United States of America. Initiating projects in the CCOP region, strategic support in workshops to the CCOP Steering Committee.
Appointed as Honorary Advisor to CCOP.
profile_positions.title: Advisor to CCOP

profile_positions.description: Manager Subsurface and Water Market TNO, portal for customers with issues on (ground)water management, water treatment, water re-use, soil and sediment, soil remediation and the exploration for subsurface raw materials. Coordinator of international business development.
profile_positions.title: Manager Water and Subsurface Market

profile_positions.description: Starting up and developing the new business centre for TNO, marketing of products of the “water” institutes in TNO, clustering/integration of knowledge for the development of new products and disseminating information to clients regarding TNO Water.
profile_positions.title: Manager TNO Water Business Centre
Head Staff Group International Cooperation
Manager Planning and Control, Corporate Head Office
Director Division Telecommunication and Defense Electronics

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for:
-	Financial results of the department;
-	Preparing and executing the research programme; identifying new areas and 
        topics for research and developing strategies for development;
-	Stimulating, directing and coordinating the marketing and selling activities of data-acquisition,
       groundwater information and system development technologies, in The Netherlands and
        abroad;
-	Chairman of SAG committee, coordinating the co-operation between the National Geological 
        Survey, TNO Institute of Applied Geoscience, the National Institute of Public Health and 
        Environmental Protection and the DLO Winand Staring Centre for Integrated Land, Soil and
        Water Research, in order to promote the exchange of data between institutes and the uniform
        dissemination and exchange of geo-scientific data to third parties.

In Mozambique: Head and Rapporteur of the Formulation Mission "Water Sector Assistance" to Mozambique. Formulation, from the perspective of integrated water resources management, of two projects that support water management at i) policy (national and strategic) level, the strengthening of the national Directorate of Water (DNA) and ii) operational (river basin) level, the setting up of the first water board,  ARA Sul. Budget of formulated projects: EUR 5.5 million.

Backstopping Mission for the evaluation of and technical support to the Hydrology Sector Assistance (HSA) project, National Directorate for Water Affairs (DNA), Maputo, Mozambique.
profile_positions.title: Head Department of Geo-Information, TNO NITG
Director Department of International Cooperation
Chief Technical Advisor to Ministry of Water resources, Kenya

profile_positions.description: National Directorate of Water (DNA). Founder of the Geohydrology Section in DNA. Technical supervisor for DNA of two major groundwater studies concerning the water supply to Maputo. Evaluation of feasibility studies and technical reports of local and foreign firms. Execution of local studies. Setting up of a computer data bank for the registration of all data on boreholes, wells and springs. Teaching Geohydrology to students (cooperation with UNESCO project). Author of manual on groundwater in Portuguese (400 + pages).
profile_positions.title: Deputy Project Manager/Geohydrologist

profile_positions.description: Development of a computer model to optimise water use in articulated irrigation distribution systems.
profile_positions.title: System Analyst/Hydrology Connsultant

profile_positions.description: Institute of Hydraulic Engineering, Bandung, Indonesia. Developing programme to introduce the use of systems analysis in hydrologic and geohydrologic problems. Preparing and teaching of courses to implement programme. Application of the SSAR hydrologic model to the Brantas River basin (9,000 km2) in East Java.
profile_positions.title: Associate Expert in Systems Analysis

profile_positions.description: Institute of Hydraulic Engineering, Bandung, Indonesia. Developing programme to introduce the use of systems analysis in hydrologic and geohydrologic problems. Preparing and teaching of courses to implement programme. Application of the SSAR hydrologic model to the Brantas River basin (9,000 km2) in East Java.
profile_positions.title: Associate Expert in Systems Analysis

profile_positions.description: Water Resources Research Institute, University of Idaho, USA. Development of numerical methods to simulate groundwater flow. Water balance studies, electric resistivity surveys and drilling of observation wells. Development of a digital groundwater model with automated parameter calibration routine. PhD research on modelling the whole Snake River basin, 22,000 km2, to determine aquifer parameters and optimise irrigation.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate
